intro: Laserpitium ulopterum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gentian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It blooms during the summer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
